column5: Watch these massive fish hustle and bustle through the core of the city for their annual spawn. https://youtu.be/lfuF7NHVzCo

Cool, I wonder when they are not a native species and were stocked how they know which stream to head up. Do they stock them in the rivers hoping they will figure out to head downstream to the big lake?

Good question - there is the concept of imprinting so the fish know where to return. They normally release the fry in the river and if they're able to survive for 1-2 yrs - they'll return when it's time to spawn. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

I think they are usually stocked in rivers, imprint on that river, and return to it. In Wisconsin, they stock some in harbors on L. Michigan. I think these fish return to the harbor, and then just find a local river. Imprinting isn't 100%. Some stray. straying is a good evolutionary strategy.
